abstract: Companies across country are trimming personal office space as a way to cut costs; data from CoreNet Global suggests that average amount of space per office worker in North America has dropped to 176 square feet in 2012, from 225 in 2010; trend has significantly reduced availability of private space at offices.
lead_paragraph: The average amount of space per office worker in North America dropped to 176 square feet in 2012, from 225 in 2010, as companies have sought to cut costs.

headline.main: As Office Space Shrinks, So Does Privacy for Workers
headline.print_headline: As Office Space Shrinks, So Does Workers’ Privacy

snippet: The average amount of space per office worker in North America dropped to 176 square feet in 2012, from 225 in 2010, as companies have sought to cut costs.
